20.text: P24/3943 is located approximately 80km north north west of Kalgoorlie and approximately 20 km west of the

21.text: Goongarrie Line deposits within the Kalgoorlie Nickel Project (KNP).  The tenement is close to the Davyhurst

22.text: project owned by Consolidated Gold and the Siberia Gold mine owned by Siberia Mining Company.

24.text: Access to the area is via the Kalgoorlie-Leonora highway.  Numerous station and fence line tracks, plus old

25.text: grid lines provide reasonable internal access from this road to the tenements (Figure 1).

30.text: P24/3943 is contained within the Mt Burges Pastoral Lease (3114/1222) and on the Kalgoorlie (SH51-09)

text:
P24/3943 is located approximately 80km north north west of Kalgoorlie and approximately 20 km west of the 
 Goongarrie Line deposits within the Kalgoorlie Nickel Project (KNP).  The tenement is close to the Davyhurst 
 project owned by Consolidated Gold and the Siberia Gold mine owned by Siberia Mining Company.   
 Access to the area is via the Kalgoorlie-Leonora highway.  Numerous station and fence line tracks, plus old 
 grid lines provide reasonable internal access from this road to the tenements (Figure 1).   
 P24/3943 is contained within the Mt Burges Pastoral Lease (3114/1222) and on the Kalgoorlie (SH51-09)

32.text: The strike parallel Bardoc Tectonic Zone is the major structural influence of the geological domain.

34.text: The  model  for  the  formation  of  the  differentiated  ultramafic  units  involves  initial  cataclysmic  eruption  of

35.text: komatiite  magma  with  very  high  effusion  rates.    As  this  turbulently  flowing  sheet  of  lava  with  dimensions

36.text: measured  in  the  10’s  to  100’s  of  kilometres  cooled,  olivine  crystals  grew  and  settled,  forming  an

37.text: compositional “adcumulate pile”, resulting in insitu crystal fractionation.  Further cooling of the now olivine-

38.text: depleted  lava  resulted  in  a  change  to  olivine  orthocumulate,  pyroxene  cumulate,  plagioclase-pyroxene

39.text: cumulates  and  then  non-cumulate  gabbro  at  the  top  of  the  sequence.    These  upper  “facies”  are  non-

40.text: prospective for nickel laterite mineralisation.  The adcumulate pile at Siberia North is up to 1,500m thick.

43.text: naturally  contain  approximately  0.25%  Ni.    When  weathered,  soluble  by-products  are  removed  from  the

44.text: profile  resulting  in  a  concentration  of  less  soluble  minerals,  which  includes  nickel  minerals.    Further

51.text: which includes a variety of cumulate lithologies and an array of thin flows, which contain both olivine and

56.text: The Siberia North project occurs specifically within an adcumulate sheet with a sub-aerial extent of 25km by

57.text: 1.5km,  with  nickel  laterite  mineralisation  throughout.    Zones  of  increased  structural  complexity  are

58.text: recognised as having been subjected to more pervasive weathering and accordingly better Ni grades result.

text:
of the granites. The greenstone package has been broadly correlated  within the stratigraphic successions 
 established in the Kalgoorlie area (Witt, 1994).   
 The strike parallel Bardoc Tectonic Zone is the major structural influence of the geological domain. 
 The  model  for  the  formation  of  the  differentiated  ultramafic  units  involves  initial  cataclysmic  eruption  of 
 komatiite  magma  with  very  high  effusion  rates.    As  this  turbulently  flowing  sheet  of  lava  with  dimensions 
 measured  in  the  10’s  to  100’s  of  kilometres  cooled,  olivine  crystals  grew  and  settled,  forming  an 
 compositional “adcumulate pile”, resulting in insitu crystal fractionation.  Further cooling of the now olivine-
 depleted  lava  resulted  in  a  change  to  olivine  orthocumulate,  pyroxene  cumulate,  plagioclase-pyroxene 
 cumulates  and  then  non-cumulate  gabbro  at  the  top  of  the  sequence.    These  upper  “facies”  are  non-
 prospective for nickel laterite mineralisation.  The adcumulate pile at Siberia North is up to 1,500m thick. 
 Adcumulate  rocks  found  at  Siberia  North  are  made  up  entirely  of  close-packed  crystalline  olivine,  and 
 naturally  contain  approximately  0.25%  Ni.    When  weathered,  soluble  by-products  are  removed  from  the 
 profile  resulting  in  a  concentration  of  less  soluble  minerals,  which  includes  nickel  minerals.    Further 
 hydromorphic  processes  are  apparent  at  palaeo-watertables,  where  additional  concentration  of  nickel  and 
 3.1.1  STRUCTURAL INTERPRETATION 
 Mapping  and  aeromagnetic  interpretations  at  Siberia  North  have  shown  the  overall  stratigraphy  to  be 
 structurally  extremely  complex.    The  ultramafic  rocks  of  the  area  exhibit  a  complex  internal  stratigraphy 
 which includes a variety of cumulate lithologies and an array of thin flows, which contain both olivine and 
 pyroxene  spinifex  textures,  olivine  harrisites,  and  irregularly  distributed  amygdales.  Vesicular  textures  are 
 believed to have formed during a degassing period, and facilitates the establishment of facing directions for 
 The Siberia North project occurs specifically within an adcumulate sheet with a sub-aerial extent of 25km by 
 1.5km,  with  nickel  laterite  mineralisation  throughout.    Zones  of  increased  structural  complexity  are 
 recognised as having been subjected to more pervasive weathering and accordingly better Ni grades result.

11.text: in the project area is poor.  The area is generally covered by a layer of Tertiary to Recent soils which can

14.text: Table 2: Typical Profile from Siberia North

text:
P24/3943 covers granitic gneisses to the east of the prospective Walter Williams Formation (WWF).  Outcrop 
 in the project area is poor.  The area is generally covered by a layer of Tertiary to Recent soils which can 
 reach thickness of approximately 25m.

29.text: Since  acquisition  of  the  tenement  by  Heron,  historic  exploration  data  was  incorporated  into  Heron’s

30.text: database.  In accordance  with the recommendations of Snowdens (2004), Heron’s existing  database was

31.text: reviewed and validated prior to being incorporated into IALP’s KNP dataset.

33.text: A review of data available in open file mineral exploration reports was also undertaken during the reporting

34.text: period.  Compilation of historic exploration data is ongoing.

39.text: Regional multiclient TMI aeromagnetic data over the Siberia North Project was acquired during the reporting

40.text: period.  There is a strong magnetic signature that defines the ultramafic sequence in the regional magnetic

41.text: survey.    This  can  be  clearly  seen  on  the  aeromagnetic  image  (see  Figure  4).    It  is  also  clear  that  this

42.text: prospective ultramafic body does not occur within tenement P24/3943 which is interpreted to cover gneissic

text:
Since  acquisition  of  the  tenement  by  Heron,  historic  exploration  data  was  incorporated  into  Heron’s 
 database.  In accordance  with the recommendations of Snowdens (2004), Heron’s existing  database was 
 reviewed and validated prior to being incorporated into IALP’s KNP dataset.  
 A review of data available in open file mineral exploration reports was also undertaken during the reporting 
 period.  Compilation of historic exploration data is ongoing. 
 Aeromagnetic Interpretation 
 Regional multiclient TMI aeromagnetic data over the Siberia North Project was acquired during the reporting 
 period.  There is a strong magnetic signature that defines the ultramafic sequence in the regional magnetic 
 survey.    This  can  be  clearly  seen  on  the  aeromagnetic  image  (see  Figure  4).    It  is  also  clear  that  this 
 prospective ultramafic body does not occur within tenement P24/3943 which is interpreted to cover gneissic
